text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
Edited for plain language, as required by the Plain Writing Act of 2010.
) Removed references to Correspondex and added Enterprise Case Management. (
) Made editorial changes throughout. (
) Incorporated internal controls, as required by IRM
This supersedes IRM 7.22.1 dated September 14, 2015.

Letter Automation Systems Overview 7.22.1

) This IRM gives an overview of the systems used to process Exempt tions (EO) determination letter applications. These systems are used by EO employees processing determination letter requests and responding to taxpayer inquiries related to exempt organizations. • Purpose: This IRM provides an overview of the systems used to process determination letter requests. • Audience: The procedures in this manual apply to EO employees cessing determination letter requests. • Policy Owner: Director, Exempt Organizations, Rulings and Agree- ments. • Program Owner: Exempt Organizations, Rulings and Agreements. • Primary Stakeholders: Exempt Organizations, Rulings and Agree- ments. (
) EO includes two primary operational areas: Rulings and Agreements (R&A) and Examinations. (
) EO R&A is responsible for issuing determination letters on exempt status, private foundation classiﬁcation, and other determinations related to exempt organizations. (
) EO R&A uses several systems to process determination letter requests, are described in this IRM. (
) Rev. Proc.

, updated annually, sets forth procedures for issuing nation letters on issues under the jurisdiction of the Director, EO R&A. It explains the procedures for issuing determination letters on exempt status response to applications for recognition of exemption from federal income under Section
or

, updated annually), private foundation classiﬁcation, and other related to exempt organizations. Rev. Proc.
also provides guidance the exhaustion of administrative remedies for purposes of declaratory under IRC
and guidance on applicable user fees for requesting nation letters. (
) EO Determinations is primarily responsible for issuing determination letters matters described in Rev. Proc.

) A determination letter is a written statement EO Determinations issues to organization that applies previously announced principles and precedents speciﬁc set of facts on matters described in Rev. Proc.
, (updated annually). (

) Within EO R&A, the systems used to process determination cases include Letter Information Network User-fee System (LINUS), Modiﬁed EO-EP mination System (MEDS), Employee Plans/Exempt Organizations Determination System (EDS), and Employee Plans/Exempt Organizations plications Control System (EACS). (
) Campus Support inputs the data to control user fees for paper letter tions. (
) The Adjustments Unit controls dishonored payments and refunds. Internal Revenue Manual

This IRM gives an overview of the systems used to process Exempt Organiza- tions (EO) determination letter applications. These systems are used by EO employees processing determination letter requests and responding to taxpayer inquiries related to exempt organizations.

Purpose: This IRM provides an overview of the systems used to process determination letter requests. Audience: The procedures in this manual apply to EO employees cessing determination letter requests. Policy Owner: Director, Exempt Organizations, Rulings and Agree
ments. Program Owner: Exempt Organizations, Rulings and Agreements. Primary Stakeholders: Exempt Organizations, Rulings and Agree
ments.

EO includes two primary operational areas: Rulings and Agreements (R&A) and Examinations. EO R&A is responsible for issuing determination letters on exempt status, private foundation classiﬁcation, and other determinations related to exempt organizations. EO R&A uses several systems to process determination letter requests, are described in this IRM. Rev. Proc.

, updated annually, sets forth procedures for issuing nation letters on issues under the jurisdiction of the Director, EO R&A. It explains the procedures for issuing determination letters on exempt status in response to applications for recognition of exemption from federal income tax under Section
or
(other than those subject to Rev. Proc.
, updated annually), private foundation classiﬁcation, and other determinations related to exempt organizations. Rev. Proc.
also provides guidance the exhaustion of administrative remedies for purposes of declaratory under IRC
and guidance on applicable user fees for requesting determi- nation letters.
) EO Determinations is primarily responsible for issuing determination letters on matters described in Rev. Proc.

) A determination letter is a written statement EO Determinations issues to an organization that applies previously announced principles and precedents to a speciﬁc set of facts on matters described in Rev. Proc.
, (updated annually). (

) Within EO R&A, the systems used to process determination cases include Letter Information Network User-fee System (LINUS), Modiﬁed EO-EP Deter- mination System (MEDS), Employee Plans/Exempt Organizations Determination System (EDS), and Employee Plans/Exempt Organizations Ap- plications Control System (EACS). (
) Campus Support inputs the data to control user fees for paper letter applica- tions. (
) The Adjustments Unit controls dishonored payments and refunds.

A determination letter is a written statement EO Determinations issues to an organization that applies previously announced principles and precedents to a speciﬁc set of facts on matters described in Rev. Proc.
, (updated annually).

7.22 Exempt Organizations Determination Letter Automation Systems
Exempt Organizations Determinations Quality Assurance (EODQA) reviews determination cases to ensure:

Technical accuracy Adherence to written procedures Uniform and impartial treatment of exempt organizations’ interests while protecting the government’s interest Identiﬁcation of unfavorable case patterns, trends affecting processing quality, problem areas, unique issues, and new or novel techniques that Exempt Organizations Determinations (EOD) specialists develop

) Letter Information Network User-fee System (LINUS) is the user fee system EO Determinations. a. Campus Support inputs the initial data to control the user fee for all paper determination letter applications. The information automatically transmits to the Modiﬁed EO-EP Determination System (MEDS). See IRM
, Processing Employee Plan and Exempt Organization mination Applications and User Fees. b. Pay.gov transmits user fee information from Forms
-EZ,
, and
-A to LINUS. c. The EP/EO Determinations Processing Adjustments Unit inputs data in LINUS for dishonored checks and refunds. See IRM
, Processing User Fees. (
) MEDS is the web-based information system for electronic case and inventory management that EO Determinations uses to process determination letter requests. See IRM
, Modiﬁed EO-EP Determination System (MEDS) User Manual, for detailed MEDS system information. (
) Employee Plans/Exempt Organizations Determination System (EDS) is EO’s determination system of record. See IRM
, EP/EO Determination (EDS) User Manual, for detailed EDS system information. (
) Employee Plans/Exempt Organizations Applications Control System (EACS) links EDS and the EO Business Master File (Master File). See IRM
, EDS Unpostables, for information on data transfer from EDS to EACS. a. A case opening establishes a new entity on Master File (Transaction Code
) or updates the existing entity (Transaction Code
) if the applicant’s EIN is included on the National Account Proﬁle. EO can also execute name changes (Transaction Code
) and/or address (Transaction Code
) for existing entities. (

) Business Objects (BOBJ) is the management information system EO uses to gather, access, analyze, share, and correlate data from EDS and MEDS. (
) Integrated Data Retrieval System (IDRS) is the system EO uses to access Master File for research and to update or correct unrestricted ﬁelds on Master File, when necessary. (
) Enterprise Case Management (ECM) is the electronic system used by the respondence Unit to process and respond to correspondence received from taxpayers relating to their tax exempt status.
